intro: Lithocarpus harmandii subsp. malacotrichus, commonly known as the Malacotrichus stone oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, woody fruits and evergreen leaves. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Vietnam and Laos. The plant typically grows as a tall evergreen tree, reaching heights of up to 30 meters, with a dense canopy and thick, leathery foliage. Its fruit is a dry, one-seeded nut enclosed in a thick, woody cupule, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Lithocarpus. This species is valued for its durable wood and plays an important ecological role in its native habitats.
